contentSection.headline: Build Strategic HR Capabilities That Drive Business Results
contentSection.description: Strategic HR Management is 2.5 intensive days where you'll master the frameworks that transform HR from administrative function to strategic business partner—workforce planning, retention strategy, performance systems, and the metrics that get you a seat at the leadership table.
benefits: Complete strategic HR framework – Workforce planning, talent acquisition strategy, retention & engagement, leadership development, performance management, compensation strategy, and HR analytics
Real-world application – Work through strategic workforce challenges, retention crises, performance system design, and the business problems you'll face as an HR leader
Expert instruction – Learn from senior HR leaders and practitioners who have built high-performing HR functions and earned seats at executive tables
Professional certification – Earn your certificate plus 16.75 SHRM/HRCI continuing education credits

header.title: What You'll Master in 2.5 Days
header.description: A comprehensive strategic HR framework covering the strategic role of HR, talent acquisition, retention & engagement, leadership development, performance management, compensation strategy, workplace culture, HR analytics, and strategic case study application.

blocks.label: Full Program
blocks.title: Strategic HR Management
blocks.description: Build strategic HR capabilities that position you as a business partner and drive organizational results.

competencyGroups.title: The Strategic Role of HR in 2026
competencyGroups.description: Elevate HR as a business risk manager and culture architect with metrics leaders trust.

skills.title: HR metrics that executives actually listen to
skills.description: Report leading indicators tied to revenue, cost, and risk.

skills.title: HR as business risk manager + culture architect
skills.description: Integrate legal, financial, and cultural risk into business decisions.

skills.title: Workforce planning in a skills-based economy
skills.description: Forecast and build skills portfolios, not just headcount.

competencyGroups.title: Talent Acquisition & Workforce Planning
competencyGroups.description: Design roles for hybrid teams and hire skills-first while protecting the brand.

skills.title: Job design for hybrid/distributed teams
skills.description: Design roles for clarity, autonomy, and measurable outcomes.

skills.title: Skills-based hiring vs credential-based hiring
skills.description: Source and assess by capability evidence, not pedigree.

skills.title: Employment branding in a candidate-skeptical labor market
skills.description: Convey proof, not slogans—career growth, flexibility, and impact.

skills.title: Psychological contract in the post-COVID workforce
skills.description: Reset expectations on flexibility, trust, and development.

competencyGroups.title: Retention & Engagement Strategy
competencyGroups.description: Prevent disengagement and build mobility that keeps top performers.

skills.title: Internal mobility as a retention strategy
skills.description: Create pathways and visibility so talent moves before it leaves.

skills.title: Why employees stay (2026 version, not 2016 version)
skills.description: Prioritize meaning, growth, flexibility, and manager quality.

skills.title: Preventing disengagement before it becomes turnover
skills.description: Detect risk signals early and intervene with targeted actions.

skills.title: Stay interviews > exit interviews
skills.description: Use structured conversations to surface fixable issues sooner.

competencyGroups.title: Talent & Leadership Development
competencyGroups.description: Build future-ready skills, succession, and manager capability.

skills.title: Career pathways and succession readiness
skills.description: Map roles, skills, and readiness with objective criteria.

skills.title: Future-ready skill building (not just training)
skills.description: Deliver practice, projects, and coaching that change behavior.

skills.title: Manager capability as retention lever
skills.description: Equip managers to set clarity, coach well, and build trust.

skills.title: Realigning underperformers without turnover spikes
skills.description: Use fair plans and supports that improve results quickly.

competencyGroups.title: Performance Management as a Strategic System
competencyGroups.description: Shift from activity to value with continuous, fair performance systems.

skills.title: Measuring value, not tasks
skills.description: Define outputs and impact to replace activity metrics.

skills.title: Continuous feedback vs annual ratings
skills.description: Adopt light-weight, frequent touchpoints that drive growth.

skills.title: Performance calibration to ensure fairness
skills.description: Compare across teams to remove rater bias and drift.

skills.title: Coaching for development vs coaching for documentation
skills.description: Split growth coaching from compliance documentation cleanly.

competencyGroups.title: Compensation & Total Rewards Strategy
competencyGroups.description: Use transparent, market-smart rewards that drive retention.

skills.title: Pay transparency as a trust-building tool
skills.description: Use ranges, rationales, and progressions to build credibility.

skills.title: Market pricing in unpredictable labor markets
skills.description: Blend surveys and real-time signals for resilient ranges.

skills.title: Differentiated rewards for critical roles
skills.description: Invest more where scarcity and impact are highest.

skills.title: Linking rewards to retention, not just performance
skills.description: Tie incentives to staying power and skill criticality.

competencyGroups.title: Workplace Culture, Trust, and Organizational Health
competencyGroups.description: Manage cultural risk, rebuild trust, and handle dissent constructively.

skills.title: Psychological safety & leadership credibility
skills.description: Leaders earn trust through consistency, clarity, and care.

skills.title: Cultural risk ≠ legal risk (but both must be managed)
skills.description: Track culture signals alongside compliance to reduce surprises.

skills.title: Restoring culture after turnover or change
skills.description: Rebuild norms with rituals, stories, and visible decisions.

skills.title: Managing dissent, not suppressing it
skills.description: Channel disagreement into better choices and stronger buy-in.

competencyGroups.description: Turn HR data into decisions with predictive, executive-ready reporting.

skills.description: Pair data with clear actions, owners, and timelines.

skills.title: HR dashboards executives care about
skills.description: Show few, high-signal metrics tied to outcomes and risk.

skills.title: Cost of turnover & ROI of retention
skills.description: Quantify avoidable churn and returns on retention levers.

skills.title: Predictive HR (leading indicators, not lagging)

skills.title: Translate legal compliance → workforce strategy

skills.title: Align HR levers with organizational goals

faq.question: What happens after I register?
faq.answer: Within minutes, you'll receive an invoice email. Once payment is processed, you can schedule your complimentary pre-program consultation (10-15 minutes) to discuss your specific HR strategic challenges—whether you're building a workforce plan, tackling retention issues, or positioning HR for greater influence in your organization. Pre-program materials arrive one week before your session starts.

faq.question: What's the difference between in-person and virtual formats?
faq.answer: Both formats feature the same senior HR leader instructors, current strategic frameworks, and professional credits. In-person provides face-to-face networking with other HR professionals. Virtual delivers the same live instruction via Zoom with full Q&A capability. Choose the format that fits your schedule—the quality and content remain identical.

faq.question: What continuing education credits will I earn?
faq.answer: The 2.5-day program provides 16.75 SHRM/HRCI credits. Plus, your enrollment includes 12 months of quarterly employment law updates (4 sessions × 1.5 credits each = 6 additional credits), bringing your total to 22.75 credits.

faq.question: Is this the same as Block II of the Certificate in Strategic HR Leadership?
faq.answer: Yes. Strategic HR Management is Block II of the full Certificate in Strategic HR Leadership program. You can take it as a standalone 2.5-day program, or combine it with HR Law Fundamentals (Block I) to earn the full certificate and save $575.

faq.question: Do I need legal HR knowledge before taking this program?
faq.answer: Not necessarily, but having a solid legal foundation helps. Strategic HR decisions are more effective when you understand the legal boundaries. If you're unsure about your employment law knowledge, consider taking HR Law Fundamentals (Block I) first, or enrolling in the full Certificate in Strategic HR Leadership to get both components.

faq.question: Will this help me move from HR generalist to HR business partner or director roles?
faq.answer: That's exactly who this program is designed for. You'll learn the strategic frameworks that distinguish business partners from administrative support: workforce planning aligned with business goals, retention strategies that reduce costly turnover, performance systems that drive results, and the metrics executives actually care about. You'll walk away speaking leadership's language, not just HR's.

faq.question: How is this different from other HR strategy programs?
faq.answer: Most HR strategy programs are theoretical. This one is practical. You'll work through real strategic challenges with senior HR leaders who have built high-performing HR functions. The program culminates in a live case study where you build a simplified HR strategic plan and receive feedback. You leave with frameworks you can implement Monday morning.

faq.question: Does the $1,775 program fee include everything?
faq.answer: Yes. Your enrollment includes all live instruction from senior HR leaders and practitioners, complete program materials, 16.75 continuing education credits, pre-program consultation, 12 months of quarterly employment law updates (4 sessions, $1,588 value), permanent access to updated resources, and alumni benefits for all future programs. The only additional cost would be travel and lodging if you choose in-person format.

faq.question: Can I apply this toward the full Certificate in Strategic HR Leadership?
faq.answer: Yes. Strategic HR Management (Block II) counts toward the full certificate. You can complete HR Law Fundamentals (Block I) at any future session to earn the complete Certificate in Strategic HR Leadership.
